newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak blue chips mixed as SAX index edges up.
newsitem.headline: Slovak blue chips mixed as SAX index edges up.

text.p: Major Slovak shares closed mixed in flat trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Tuesday, as the SAX index edged up 0.04 points to 189.03.
Oil refinery Slovnaft closed down 10 at 840, but its average price -- on which the index is calculated -- firmed 0.12 percent.
Steel maker VSZ closed unchanged at 640 crowns, while both oil and gas storage company Nafta and commercial bank VUB did not trade on Tuesday.
"It was a normal session with no surprises, generally only confirming the latest development on the market," said Radovan Dzugas of Creditanstalt.

"I think the price growth in Slovnaft is well-supported by the company's performance. It has the potential to rise further as it is an attractive share to long-term investors, who apparently would not let it fall in price," he added.
Overall volume increased to 664,542 shares, from 441,392 shares traded on Monday, while turnover rose to 304.42 million crowns, from 237.51 million.
